column4: Salesforce third-quarter revenue forecast misses  shares fall
column5: Cloud software maker Salesforce.com Inc  forecast third-quarter revenue below estimates as it saw some softness  primarily in the United States  sending the company's shares down by 7.7 percent in extended trading.

column4: BRIEF-Salesforce Q2 non-GAAP EPS $0.24
column5: * Q2 earnings per share view $0.22 -- Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S

column4: Salesforce.com's quarterly revenue rises 25 percent
column5: Aug 31 Cloud software maker Salesforce.com Inc  reported a 25 percent rise in quarterly revenue as demand for its web-based sales and marketing software increased.

column4: BRIEF-Ship Finance International qtrly earnings per share $0.42
column5: * Q2 earnings per share view $0.51 -- Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S

column4: Petrobras oil-rights sale to Statoil to free up about $11 billion: CEO
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Petrobras' sale of offshore oil rights in Brazil to Norway's Statoil ASA  will free up about $11 billion that Brazil's cash-strapped state-run oil company can use to pay debt or develop areas that promise a quicker return  the company's chief executive said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Petrobras oil-rights sale to Statoil to free up about $11 bln - CEO
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Aug 30 Petrobras' sale of offshore oil rights in Brazil to Norway's Statoil ASA  will free up about $11 billion that Brazil's cash-strapped state-run oil company can use to pay debt or develop areas that promise a quicker return  the company's chief executive said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 4-U.S. sues to stop Deere from buying Precision Planting
column5: WASHINGTON/CHICAGO  Aug 31 The U.S. Justice Department filed a lawsuit on Wednesday aimed at stopping Deere & Co from buying Monsanto Co's Precision Planting farm equipment business  saying that the deal could make it more expensive for farmers to use fast  precise planting technology.

column4: Hedge fund Barington hires Moss from Optima to head marketing
column5: BOSTON  Aug 31 Activist hedge fund Barington Capital has hired a new executive to spearhead marketing and investor relations at a time when the fund is putting up strong numbers but as investors' taste for portfolio managers who push for corporate change has ebbed.

column4: BRIEF-United Continental CEO Oscar Munoz says "We are market based and have to differentiate our product in many ways" - CNBC
column5: * United Continental CEO Oscar Munoz says "We are market based and have to differentiate our product in many ways  pricing isn't the only one" - CNBC

column4: U.S. grants Havana routes to 8 airlines  led by American
column5: The U.S. government on Wednesday granted eight U.S. airlines permission to begin scheduled commercial flights to Havana starting as early as this fall  with American Airlines Group Inc  being awarded 35 direct flights a week.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. grants Havana routes to 8 airlines  led by American
column5: Aug 31 The U.S. government on Wednesday granted eight U.S. airlines permission to begin scheduled commercial flights to Havana starting as early as this fall  with American Airlines Group Inc being awarded 35 direct flights a week.

column4: UPS pilots ratify new five-year labor contract
column5: Aug 31 United Parcel Service Inc's  pilots ratified a new five-year labor contract that includes immediate pay hikes  the company and the union representing the pilots said.
